description: Either formed anew from ship +‎ -er or borrowed from Middle Low German schipper; compare skipper and Old English sċipere (“sailor”).

entries.meaning: The person or organization that ships (sends) something.
examples: The shipper should have paid for insurance on the package, because it was damaged when it arrived.

entries.meaning: A box for shipping something fragile, such as bottled beer or wine.

description: From a clipping of relationshipper. Relationshipper emerged in early online fandom of the television series The X-Files as a term for fans who supported the possibility of a Mulder/Scully romance. It was shortened to r'shipper, then 'shipper, and finally shipper.

entries.meaning: (fandom slang) A person who supports a romantic or sexual relationship between fictional characters or real people.
